title: SNMP Community String
description:
You discover SNMP (port 161/UDP) is open on a network device. You attempt to query it using common community strings:

$ snmpwalk -v2c -c public 192.168.1.1
SNMPv2-MIB::sysDescr.0 = STRING: Cisco IOS Software, 2800 Series
SNMPv2-MIB::sysName.0 = STRING: core-router-01
...

The community string 'public' gave you read access. This is a serious misconfiguration.

What is the default SNMP community string for WRITE access (which would let you modify the device configuration)?

Submit as: flag{community_string}
hints: SNMP has two default community strings: one for read, one for write
The read-write default is the opposite of 'public'
